de.hs_bremen.vkb

Class LatinKeyboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.inputmethodservice.Keyboard
      • de.hs_bremen.vkb.LatinKeyboard

  • public class LatinKeyboard
extends Keyboard
    The keyboard for VKB (Virtual KeyBoard).
    Since:
    Class available since Release 1.0.0
    Version:
    Release: @package_version@
    Author:
    Tobias Groch , Florian Wolters

    • Constructor Detail

      • LatinKeyboard

        public LatinKeyboard(Context context,
             int xmlLayoutResId)
        Creates a keyboard from the given xml key layout file.
        Parameters:
        context - the application or service context.
        xmlLayoutResId - the resource file that contains the keyboard layout and keys.

      • LatinKeyboard

        public LatinKeyboard(Context context,
             int layoutTemplateResId,
             CharSequence characters,
             int columns,
             int horizontalPadding)
        Creates a blank keyboard from the given resource file and populates it with the specified characters in left-to-right, top-to-bottom fashion, using the specified number of columns.
        Parameters:
        context - the application or service context.
        layoutTemplateResId - the layout template file, containing no keys.
        characters - the list of characters to display on the keyboard. One key will be created for each character.
        columns - the number of columns of keys to display. If this number is greater than the number of keys that can fit in a row, it will be ignored. If this number is -1, the keyboard will fit as many keys as possible in each row.
        horizontalPadding - the horizontal padding between two keys.

    • Method Detail

      • isPcShiftActive

        public final boolean isPcShiftActive()
        Returns whether the PC shift key of this keyboard is pressed.
        Returns:
        true if the key is pressed, false otherwise.

      • setPcShiftState

        public final boolean setPcShiftState(boolean bSTATE)
        Sets the state of the PC shift key of this keyboard.
        Parameters:
        bSTATE - true if the key is pressed, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the state has been changed, false otherwise.
